subject: instinct greatly
body:
THOMPSON PASS 650 AM ADT SUN APR 15 2007 . This 
same information is available in other file formats including the XML based RSS and 
CAP formats.
THIS ADVISORY INCLUDES THE COMMUNITIES OF YES BAY 
AND BELL ISLAND.
SOUTHEAST WIND 20 TO 30 MPH WITH GUSTS UP TO 50 MPH 
BY MID MORNING.
CLOUDY SKIES WITH RAIN.
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS THROUGH THOMPSON PASS MY REACH 
UP TO 2 INCHES THIS MORNING WITH VISIBILITIES BEING REDUCED TO ONE-HALF MILE AT 
TIMES. BOAT AND AIRCRAFT OWNERS SHOULD CHECK MOORINGS AND TIEDOWNS AS 
NECESSARY.
WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS 
EVENING. EXCEPT SNOW ABOVE 500 FEET AND RISING THROUGH THE MORNING. WIND ADVISORY 
REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM SUNDAY UNTIL 12 AM ADT MONDAY. WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN 
EFFECT FROM 9 AM SUNDAY UNTIL 6 PM ADT MONDAY NEAR THE COAST.
MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES WITH RAIN OCCASIONAL MIXING 
WITH SNOW THROUGH 1 PM. STRONG NORTHWEST WINDS TO BE FELT ACROSS THE AREA 
TODAY.
WINDY WITH SOUTH TO SOUTHEAST WIND TO 20 
MPH.
HAINES 630 AM ADT SUN APR 15 2007 . This file is 
usually updated about every two minutes. BECOMING WINDY WITH SOUTHEAST WIND 10 TO 20 
MPH. CLOUDY SKIES WITH RAIN CONTINUING THROUGH THE MORNING. RAIN MIXING WITH SNOW 
CONTINUES TO FALL ACROSS NORTHEAST PRINCE WILLIAM SOUND THIS MORNING.
CLOUDY SKIES WITH RAIN CONTINUING THROUGH THE 
MORNING.
CLOUDY SKIES WITH RAIN.
AN ADVISORY MEANS A POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS EVENT IS 
IMMINENT. KAKE 537 AM ADT SUN APR 15 2007 .
INCREASING TO 25 TO 35 MPH WITH GUSTS TO 45 MPH BY 
MID MORNING. THIS ADVISORY INCLUDES THE COMMUNITIES OF KETCHIKAN.
ALSO BE CAREFUL IN CARRYING OR OPENING LARGE FLAT 
OBJECTS SUCH AS CAR DOORS.
SHOWERS CHANGING TO RAIN THIS MORNING. WIND 
ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM SUNDAY UNTIL 12 AM ADT MONDAY. CLOUDY SKIES 
WITH RAIN CONTINUING THROUGH THE MORNING.
CLOUDY SKIES WITH RAIN CONTINUING THROUGH THE 
MORNING.
